root: ^I think the gun's actually growing on me. This is pretty fun!
^For someone who was such a Doubting Douglas about it, you're pretty handy with a gun. I'm impressed!
^Unfortunately, you're so impressive that I think I'm going to have to take away your gun.
^You're probably just going to steamroll through the rest of the game if I let you keep it.
^Well, I guess if you have to keep things interesting for the audience, then that's what we need to do.
^Wait, does that mean you're also taking away the enemy guns?
^Nah, I thought it was pretty entertaining watching you deal with that. They can stay.
^Anyways, it's back to the drawing board now. I'm running out of time to pull in new fans.
^Luckily, I have a flawless new feature guaranteed to appeal to FundHubbers!
^Have you heard of a "Quick Time Event", Tempy?
^I don't think so? Let me look it up in my memory.
^It's simple! Gameplay stops and you have a short time to press a specific button to make the character do something!
^Lots of games do it, and it always gets a really strong response from the fans.
^It adds a greater sense of connectivity between the player and the game, and-
^Are you aware that a lot of people REALLY don't like Quick Time Events? At least, that's what my search just turned up.
^According to my results, they're 'intrusive', 'immersion-breaking', 'reductive', and 'really obnoxious'.
^Well, maybe those people were wrong! Besides, I've basically finished adding them to the game.
^And honestly, I'm getting a little desperate to bring in new money.
^So just try it out! I'm sure you'll have the TIME of your life!
